name: GPT 3 Text Classification
description:
**This preset was developed for the beta versions of the OpenAI API. You might want to try the newer responses API**

With GPT 3 you can perform text classification, i.e. predict the most likely label for a query. Add your prompts as seed nodes (e.g. "I love you"), enter the access token (see below) and click the fetch data button.


**Authorization**
 
OpenAI’s API provides access to GPT-3. In order to use the OpenAI’ API, you need to register on https://openai.com/api/. After the registration, you will find a secret API key in your account settings (https://beta.openai.com/account/api-keys). In Facepager, enter the key into the access token field. *Note*: You need to pay for using the API, however, as a new user you get free credits for trial purposes.


**Get started with the preset**  

1. After creating or opening a database, add a seed node with your prompt (e.g. “I love you”) using the "Add Nodes" button. 

2. Load the preset by clicking "Apply" in the preset window. 

3. Login to OpenAI, find your API key and enter it into the access token field of Facepager.

4. Select the seed node and then click “Fetch Data”. 

**Further Options**

Within the payload field, you can customize the query.

*examples*: Defines labeled examples, which are the classification basis for the model. Adopt the syntax used in the preset.  

*query*: Define the prompt, for example “I love you”. This field is required. You can use `<Object ID>` as a placeholder, to refer to node data.  

*model*: Defines the completion model, GPT 3 provides four models: ada, davinci, curie, babbage.See https://beta.openai.com/docs/engines/overview. This field is required, the preset uses the curie model.  

For more options see the API documentation: https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/classifications

options.payload:
{
  "query": "<Object ID>",
  "labels": ["Positive", "Negative", "Neutral"],
  "examples": [
    ["A happy moment", "Positive"],
    ["I am sad.", "Negative"],
    ["I am feeling awesome", "Positive"]
  ],
 "temperature": 0,
  "logprobs":1,
  "search_model": "ada",
  "model": "curie",
  "return_prompt":false
}
